body:
inside the cmder folder create vscode.bat (easiest way is to use Visual Studio Code to create and edit this new file)

 

@echo off

SET CMDER_ROOT=C:\cmder

"%CMDER_ROOT%\vendor\init.bat"

string = "I have a new red jacket and it looks great with my red car."

 

puts string.sub("red", "green")

puts string.gsub("red", "pink")

puts string

# the sub method will find the first instance

# the gsub method will find "global" gsub = global substitutiion

# Please Excuse My Dear Aunt Sally

# PEMDAS

PEMDAS =

"

P - Parentheses '()'

E - Exponents '**'

M - Multiplication '*'

D - Division '/'

A - Addition '+'

S - Subtraction '-'

"

puts PEMDAS

 

p 3 + 15 * 23 - 5 / 8**4 + (3 * 2)

# 3 + 15 * 23 - 5 / 8**4 + 6

# 3 + 15 * 23 - 5 / 4096 + 6

# 3 + 345 - 5 / 4096 + 6

# 3 + 345 - 5 / 4096 + 6

# 3 + 345 - 0 + 6

# 348 - 0 + 6

# p (5 * 4096) + (6 - 3)

 

# Integer (2, 5 , 5675)

# Float (1.2, 1.3 , 6.3)

# Decimal (2.3654121, 5.36542)

 

p 101.0 / 80.0

=begin

##

+ Addition − Adds values on either side of the operator.

a + b will give 30

##

− Subtraction − Subtracts right hand operand from left hand operand.

 a - b will give -10

##

* Multiplication − Multiplies values on either side of the operator.

a * b will give 200

##

/ Division − Divides left hand operand by right hand operand.

b / a will give 2

##

% Modulus − Divides left hand operand by right hand operand and returns remainder.

b % a will give 0

##

** Exponent − Performs exponential (power) calculation on operators.

a**b

=end

 

# Addition

p 5 + 5

 

# Subtraction

p 10 - 3

 

# Multiplication

p 2 * 3

 

# Division

p 10 / 3

p 10 / 3.0

 

# Modulus

p 10 % 3

 

# Exponents

 p 3 ** 3 

 p 3 * 3 * 3

 

#  PEMDAS

var_1 = ( 5 + 5 )

var_2 = (2 * 3)

p var_2 + var_1

system "cls"

 

PASSWORD = "1234"

@title = "Agent"

def timer_message

  puts "#{@title}-#{@name}, This message will self destruct in 5 seconds..."

  puts "5"

  sleep 1

  puts "4"

  sleep 1

  puts "3"

  sleep 1

  puts "2"

  sleep 1

  puts "1"

  sleep 1

  system 'cls'

end

 

def mission_impossible

 

  print "Please enter your name: "

  @name = gets.chomp.strip

  print "#{@name}, Please enter your password provided by agent x: "

  pass = gets.chomp.strip

 

  if pass == PASSWORD

    puts "The secret code is XCD343$$ -- Good luck #{@name}!"

  else

   timer_message

  end

end

mission_impossible

# Gosu 

https://github.com/gosu/gosu/wiki/Getting-Started-on-Windows

 

# Tutorial

https://github.com/gosu/gosu/wiki/Ruby-Tutorial

 

# KB Links

https://www.libgosu.org/cpp/namespace_gosu.html#ab085b2dbdd533b49dadaf217dbcf8368

 

# Full Code

https://github.com/gosu/gosu-examples/blob/master/examples/tutorial.rb

 

# require vs require_relative

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3672586/what-is-the-difference-between-require-relative-and-require-in-ruby

VS Code user settings

 

{

  "files.autoSave": "afterDelay", 

  "editor.tabSize": 2,

  "editor.fontSize": 20,

  "window.zoomLevel": 2,

  "editor.wordWrap": "wordWrapColumn",

  "editor.tabCompletion": true,

  "emmet.includeLanguages": {"erb": "html"},

  "files.associations": {"*.erb": "html"},  

  "terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\WINDOWS\\System32\\cmd.exe",

  "terminal.integrated.shellArgs.windows": ["/K", "C:\\cmder\\vscode.bat"]

}

create a vscode.bat file inside your cmder folder and add:

@echo off

SET CMDER_ROOT=C:\cmder

"%CMDER_ROOT%\vendor\init.bat"
